N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 1633.4 - Eligible uses

State Regulations

An authority may use a grant under this Part for: (a) innovative drug elimination programs to
reduce the use of drugs in and around public housing projects; (b) funding assistance to nonprofit public
housing resident management corporations and tenant councils to develop
security and drug abuse prevention programs involving site residents; (c) physical improvements in public housing
projects which are specifically designed to enhance security; (d) training, communication equipment, and
other related equipment for use by voluntary public housing tenant patrols
acting in cooperation with local law enforcement officials; (e) the employment of security personnel in
public housing projects; (f) the
reimbursement of local law enforcement agencies for additional security and
protective services for public housing projects; and
(g) the employment of one or more
individuals: (1)
to investigate drug-related
crime on or about the real property comprising any public housing project; and
(2)
to provide evidence
relating to any such crime in any administrative or judicial
proceeding. Notes
